actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, Treasury Department.

official_title: A bill to amend section 1034(h) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 in the case of members of the Armed Forces stationed overseas or required to reside in Government quarters.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide that the suspension of the two year period in which an individual must purchase a new residence for nonrecognition of gain on the sale of an old residence which is granted to members of the armed forces who are stationed overseas or who are required to reside in Government-owned quarters shall be extended to the later of four years after the date of the sale of the old residence (as currently provided) or one year after the date on which the taxpayer is no longer stationed overseas or required to reside in Government-owned quarters.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 1034(h) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 in the case of members of the Armed Forces stationed overseas or required to reside in Government quarters.
